conclusion: Analyzing the difference in gravitational force when a portion of the original sphere is removed.
Initial setup consists of a uniform sphere of mass M and radius R with center O and a point mass m at distance 2R from the center O.
Calculate the initial gravitational force: F_initial = G(Mm)/(4R^2).
In Figure B, a sphere of radius R/2 has been removed from the original sphere, creating a new mass distribution.
Calculate the mass of the removed sphere as M/8.
Calculate the force exerted by the removed sphere: F_removed = G(Mm)/(18R^2).
Calculate the final gravitational force: F_final = (7GMm)/(36R^2).
The gravitational force exerted by the remaining part of the sphere on the point mass m is F = (7GMm)/(36R^2).
